meanings.definition: An animal lacking a backbone or spinal column.
meanings.sent1: The ocean is home to many invertebrates like jellyfish and octopuses.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study invertebrates to learn more about their unique biology.
meanings.sent3: The invertebrate party at the aquarium was a hit with all the kids.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the ant is considered a hardworking invertebrate.
meanings.sent5: The invertebrate's ability to adapt to different environments is truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: A person or thing lacking strength or resilience.
meanings.sent1: She felt like an emotional invertebrate after the breakup, unable to cope with the pain.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge, weakened by time, was now an invertebrate structure unable to bear any weight.
meanings.sent3: The team's performance was like an invertebrate trying to lift a heavy weight - it just couldn't hold up.
meanings.sent4: His argument was so weak and shaky, it crumbled like an invertebrate under pressure.
meanings.sent5: Facing the challenge, he realized he needed to be strong, not an invertebrate, to overcome it.
